oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mineral and Agricultural Resources
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Minerals; Agriculture; Railroads
Agriculture; Railroads
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hard-bound book with the complete title of "Mineral and Agricultural Resources of the Portion of Tennessee Along the Cincinnati Southern and Knoxville & Ohio Railroads, Including the Country Between the Two." The book touts the mineral resources and agricultural capabilites of Tennessee to "attract capital and labor to the State." There are three fold-out maps showing the mineral districts situated along the Cincinnati Southern railroad route.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Killebrew, J. B. (Joseph Buckner), 1831-1906
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: At the time of the publication of this book, the Cincinnati Southern Railroad was nearing completion of its intended line from Cincinnati, Ohio to Chattanooga, Tenn.; it intersected with the Knoxville & Ohio Railroad at Careyville. The railroad was a reflection of Cincinnati's efforts to fortify its commercial position in the Upper South.
